intro: Sphaerostigma campestre var. parishii, commonly known as the Parish's spikemoss, is a rare and specialized member of the Lycopodiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing form and its unique, spiky appearance due to its specialized leaf structures. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, such as rocky crevices or forest floors, where it can access the necessary humidity. Its sporophyte structure is well-developed, with distinct stems and leaves that contribute to its distinctive morphology. This variety is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations to its ecological niche.
